title: Chicken and Olive Pâté
introduction: Chicken and Olive Pâté is a delightful twist on traditional pâté, usually made with game, pork, or veal. This Piedmontese version, crafted with tender chicken, presents a delicate balance of flavors enhanced by olives and a touch of citrus. Whether served directly from a mold or shaped into a bowl, it adds an elegant touch to any buffet. Garnish with pickled onions, cornichons, cherry tomatoes, or marinated sun-dried tomatoes for added flair.
ingredients: ½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened
½ cup imported mild black olives, such as Gaeta, pitted and coarsely chopped
instructions: 1. Place the onion, carrot, celery, and chicken in a large saucepan. Add cold water to cover and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook until the chicken is tender, about 30 minutes. Let the chicken cool slightly in the broth.

2. Transfer the chicken to a food processor fitted with a steel blade, or to a cutting board. Chop very finely. Transfer it to a large bowl and mix in the butter, lemon zest, nutmeg, garlic, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the chopped olives.
3. Line a small bowl with plastic wrap. Add the chicken mixture and pack it in firmly. Cover and chill several hours or overnight.
4. To serve, cut the pâté into 8 slices. Serve on a bed of salad greens with toasted bread.
